Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided text, several sustainable and environmental practices have been implemented by Made for Life (MFL) Organics Limited. These include using eco-friendly packaging materials, producing products without harmful chemicals or synthetic ingredients, promoting zero-waste and plastic-free initiatives, and focusing on environmentally sourced products. Additionally, they encourage responsible consumption habits among customers and emphasize the importance of reducing single-use plastics. Overall, MFL appears to be committed to minimizing its environmental impact while providing high-quality, natural skincare solutions.

source.content: re-use or even as an element in my loved art work Through these distanced natural work explorations I experience it hurts to see ‘plastic rubbish’ floating in the ocean or lakes and I see landfills overspilled into the ocean – small islands with minimal infrastructure We have simple opportunities to avoid the packaging as strongly indicated by MFL that contributes to demising our environment The animals seen out there solidify my eco product ethos to chose those that simply have no unnatural ingredients or damaging packaging materials to be negatively affected by if even lost en route The environment is so rich and beautiful but cold It pushes one to realise the need to take environmentally sourced products those that can dissolve naturally and beneficially to both the environment and skin The strength of the pure products Made for Life is one focused to make products last longer not watered down and preserved with chemicals that degrade the skin the surrounding growths Canada pushes

spread of our Made for Life Skincare products The spread of it from the environment to our treatments and letting it cleanly immerse back in to the environment Healthy and clean for both our actual bodies’ and the surroundings The nature in Canada is a site to show how fast our environment is ‘updating’ as each generation passes Perfect travel size 10ml MFL – perfect for flights camera bags pockets  even handbags… It was beautiful to see our photographer Lucia Griggi take our environmentally clean and organic products to such a nature dominated environment I had an expedition on an icebreaker vessel throughout the NE passage – from Alaska circumnavigating the arctic through Canada and through to Artic Russia finishing in Norway Simply for my photography being focused on nature travel and expeditions worldwide The climate is amazing and there is a warm environment despite the cold stark temperature enhanced by the beautiful colourful land growths found in the wooden and rocky

me a thicker barrier to make me feel comfortable Cleansing Balm here restorative body  balm here body oil here are my 3 products next in line It’s very important to know that in a strongly natural environment you can enrich and salvage it through both food choice and skin care I see the skincare as a perfect journey experience every morning – simply starting with the aroma which I indulge in every morning for a moment before nourishing my skin with the oils and balms Made for Life Skincare is a big benefit as it satiates my skin through out the day; when hiking through woods and jumping in lakes for camerawork 3 Does the plastic-free and zero waste products make a difference to your choice of product The packaging is an important life quality For which I keep the packaging either for re-use or even as an element in my loved art work Through these distanced natural work explorations I experience it hurts to see ‘plastic rubbish’ floating in the ocean or lakes and I see landfills

stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what guests can expect prior to arrival assuring them not only of our hygiene standards but also the fact that a warm even if socially distanced welcome is what awaits them And that their wellbeing and that of our team is at the forefront of everything that we do So to all my friends within the hospitality and spa industry who are an amazing community and who show huge resilience and strength remember these words from Nelson Mandela “I learned that courage was not the absence of fear but the triumph over it The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid but he who conquers that fear” Read More I have my ‘pants of power’ very firmly on Come and join me Trading Address The Health and Wellbeing Innovation Centre Treliske Truro Cornwall TR1 3FF Made For Life Organics Limited VAT Number GB Company

There is still a great deal of confusion and concern about how to move forward and throw those spa and hospitality doors wide Someone must lead and in terms of Courage Here are some thoughts which I would like to share and I hope you will find useful Courage could be used as an acronym for the following This is the start of planning and moving forward It involves good honest conversations with yourself and your teams about how you move forward and why How do you do this As a former hotelier/tourism operator when we opened up a new venture we always did a ‘soft launch’ I recommend that this is what spa operators and hoteliers do Iron out any teething problems before you open fully to the public and engage with your teams so that everyone is involved Many still will be fearful – that is where they have been sitting for weeks now It is our job as leaders to engage and reassure that there is a future Let us have balance and understanding about COVID19 and the stats regarding the illness

to be for some time My personal belief is that air travel will become more like it was when I was growing up – a rare family treat that was costly Until people gain confidence and airlines even begin to recover more people will be taking breaks within the UK These are likely to be shorter – 2-3 days as the effects on the economy from COVID19 ripple across for some time For both our teams and our guests Let us make sure that our customers and teams clearly understand that we are delighted to see them again There is an opportunity to open our doors to those who have been in the frontline – NHS workers and others and allow them access to wellness and hospitality Bottom line profit is not the sole purpose of any business It is important but reconnecting within the community and showing what we stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
In the provided text, some environmental impact metrics related to Made for Life Skincare products are mentioned. These include:

1. Environmental cleanliness: The company ensures that their products are free from harmful chemicals and artificial substances, promoting a cleaner environment for both human bodies and the surroundings.
2. Biodegradability: The products are designed to break down naturally and beneficially, reducing their impact on landfills and the environment.
3. Sustainable sourcing: Ingredients used in the products are sourced organically, supporting sustainable agriculture practices and minimizing the use of synthetic chemicals.
4. Efficient packaging: The company focuses on using minimal and recyclable packaging materials to reduce waste and conserve resources.
5. Supplier monitoring: Made for Life Skincare actively monitors its suppliers to ensure compliance with cruelty-free and eco-friendly standards.

monitor our suppliers to ensure that our products continue to adhere to the Leaping Bunny criteria Our supplier monitoring system is also independently audited For more information about Cruelty Free International Leaping Bunny and Leaping Bunny criteria Made for Life Organics track the provenance of the ingredients that we use and the crops from which they come We ensure that all ingredients are produced organically and we ensure that every ingredient we use is traceable Organic means that all of our products are completely natural and never include artificial chemicals We think that natural is best and that chemicals are unnecessary and damaging to the skin Organic is about maintaining a clean  sustainable environment both in our own bodies and the world in which we live Organic farming methods restrict the use of artificial chemical fertilisers and pesticides The places where our ingredients are grown provide havens for wildlife like bees birds and butterflies Made for Life

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, Made for Life Organics has committed to social and corporate responsibility through various initiatives. They are the first UK B Corp certified spa and wellbeing brand, which means they meet high standards of verified social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability to balance profit and purpose. Additionally, they adhere to a fixed cut-off date policy and proactively monitor their suppliers to ensure their products remain cruelty-free and compliant with the Leaping Bunny international gold standard.

source.content: notices and offers and other information about Made for Life and its products As stated above madeforlifeorganicscom does not share our customer data with third parties except as described in the next paragraph If you receive information about our products from another company Made for Life Organics has no control over the use of their data You will need to contact the company that delivered the email to opt out of receiving ongoing emails We may use third party unaffiliated companies to help us maintain and operate our web site or for other reasons related to the operation of our business and those companies may receive your personal data for that purpose Should we be required to do so we may also disclose personally identifiable information about you in connection with a legal claim governmental request or investigation Our secure server uses Secure Sockets Layer SSL encryption – the industry standard — when collecting or transferring sensitive data such as your credit card

We hand blend every product in Cornwall to ensure that everything we make is exceptional We were the first UK Bcorp certified spa and wellbeing brand This means that we meet the highest standard of verified social and environmental performance public transparency and legal accountability to balance profit and purpose Made for Life believes that beauty and household products should be cruelty free We are proud to be Leaping Bunny approved A global programme Leaping Bunny requires cruelty free standards over and above legal requirements All of our own brand cosmetic and personal care products are approved under the Cruelty Free International Leaping Bunny programme the internationally recognisable gold standard for cruelty free products We adhere to a fixed cut-off date policy and proactively monitor our suppliers to ensure that our products continue to adhere to the Leaping Bunny criteria Our supplier monitoring system is also independently audited For more information about Cruelty

As a Mum who struggled to breastfeed my second child I experienced first-hand the mental battle to continue as well as the outside pressures to stop despite my persistence to persevere Fortunately with the support and guidance of the Treliske Infant Feeding team in Cornwall have a look and the wonderful breastfeeding peer volunteers – I was successful in my journey and whole-heartedly enjoyed the breastfeeding relationship that I shared with my daughter After witnessing the incredible generosity of the volunteers I decided to complete my training and work alongside them I love supporting new Mums and Mums-to-be helping to prepare them for breastfeeding Since my involvement it has quickly become clear that no clear education or understanding of breastfeeding is given to women on a national basis – even in biology lessons and yet this is key to the improvement of breastfeeding rates in the UK What we are campaigning for is to introduce breastfeeding on the National Curriculum alongside

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
Based on the given text, some of the products, services, or technologies mentioned are:

1. Cookies - Used by websites to store user preferences and track browsing history.
2. Personal Data Usage - Made for Life Organics uses personal data for various purposes, such as identifying account holders, processing and sending orders, providing customer services, and updating customers about their products and promotions.
3. Optional Product or Service Updates - Customers can opt-in to receive notifications about updates, promotions, and offers related to Made for Life Organics and its products.
4. Access to Third-Party Tools - Users might get access to third-party tools over which Made for Life Organics has no control or monitoring. These tools are provided "as is" and "as available."
5. New Services and Features - From time to time, Made for Life Organics may introduce new services and features through the website, which are subject to the same terms and conditions as outlined in the company's Terms of Service.
6. Content from Third Parties - Some content, products, and services available on the site come from third-party sources, whose accuracy, completeness, and currency cannot be guaranteed.
7. Price Modifications - Prices for Made for Life Organics' products are subject to change without prior notice.
8. Website Suspension or Discontinuance - Made for Life Organics reserves the right to temporarily suspend or permanently discontinue the service without prior notice to users.
9. Uninterrupted and Secure Service - While Made for Life Organics strives to provide an uninterrupted and secure service, they do not guarantee this, and users accept that the service may be modified, priced changed, suspended, or discontinued at any time without prior notice.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: One significant collaboration mentioned in the text is between Made for Life Organics Limited (VAT number GB Company 84 657 9) and healthcare providers, particularly focusing on offering wellness services and experiences to individuals who have been in the frontline during the COVID-19 pandemic, including NHS workers. By opening their doors to these groups, Made for Life Organics Limited demonstrates its commitment to supporting the community and reconnecting people with wellness and hospitality. Additionally, the company mentions trading addresses and contact information, which could potentially lead to new partnerships or collaborations in the future.

source.content: Known as the Queen of Hugs Amanda is our company founder and leading light in the world of organic skincare for home and spa She has a background in hotel and events management as well as being a Reiki Master massage therapist and mindfulness trainer Outside work I like to “walk with our dogs around the vineyards close to our home in Spain feed our peacocks we had babies this year and swim at my favourite local beach” My favourite products are Facial Cleanser “I love the way if decongests and moisturises my skin The scent also gives me the perfect start and end to my day I  couldn’t live without the  Skin Solve with Calendula This is the first product I used on my family to soothe and solve my young daughter’s eczema” Known as the King of spreadsheets Geoff has worked for Made for Life for over 9 years but previously worked for many years in aerospace manufacturing and now brings his attention to detail to our organisation and products Outside work I like to “work on our old farmhouse

spread of our Made for Life Skincare products The spread of it from the environment to our treatments and letting it cleanly immerse back in to the environment Healthy and clean for both our actual bodies’ and the surroundings The nature in Canada is a site to show how fast our environment is ‘updating’ as each generation passes Perfect travel size 10ml MFL – perfect for flights camera bags pockets  even handbags… It was beautiful to see our photographer Lucia Griggi take our environmentally clean and organic products to such a nature dominated environment I had an expedition on an icebreaker vessel throughout the NE passage – from Alaska circumnavigating the arctic through Canada and through to Artic Russia finishing in Norway Simply for my photography being focused on nature travel and expeditions worldwide The climate is amazing and there is a warm environment despite the cold stark temperature enhanced by the beautiful colourful land growths found in the wooden and rocky

stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what guests can expect prior to arrival assuring them not only of our hygiene standards but also the fact that a warm even if socially distanced welcome is what awaits them And that their wellbeing and that of our team is at the forefront of everything that we do So to all my friends within the hospitality and spa industry who are an amazing community and who show huge resilience and strength remember these words from Nelson Mandela “I learned that courage was not the absence of fear but the triumph over it The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid but he who conquers that fear” Read More I have my ‘pants of power’ very firmly on Come and join me Trading Address The Health and Wellbeing Innovation Centre Treliske Truro Cornwall TR1 3FF Made For Life Organics Limited VAT Number GB Company

to be for some time My personal belief is that air travel will become more like it was when I was growing up – a rare family treat that was costly Until people gain confidence and airlines even begin to recover more people will be taking breaks within the UK These are likely to be shorter – 2-3 days as the effects on the economy from COVID19 ripple across for some time For both our teams and our guests Let us make sure that our customers and teams clearly understand that we are delighted to see them again There is an opportunity to open our doors to those who have been in the frontline – NHS workers and others and allow them access to wellness and hospitality Bottom line profit is not the sole purpose of any business It is important but reconnecting within the community and showing what we stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what

source.content: over 9 years but previously worked for many years in aerospace manufacturing and now brings his attention to detail to our organisation and products Outside work I like to “work on our old farmhouse ride my Harley Davidson restore classic motorcycles walk and swim” My favourite products Soothing Muscle Balm “this product works brilliantly to soothe aching muscles at the end of a busy day working in the garden or long-distance motorcycle riding I also love the Skin Solve with Calendula which I use to soothe dry skin and all the cuts and scratches I get in the garage and garden” Emma has worked for over 30 years in the spa beauty and wellness industry managing multi-site beauty operations for Virgin Active and Nuffield Health “I love spending time with my family and have recently discovered a passion for cooking  I regularly run and can walk for miles with our lovely dog” My favourite product To pick a favourite isn’t easy  I love the Sore Skin Relief Balm an amazing balm that instantly

Realised by a chain of “what felt like energy deficient moments and light headedness” A heavy hit which followed the loss of her husband to cancer the year before Brain Surgery on the Temporal lobe went ahead and then she was then put through post-op treatment radiotherapy and chemotherapy which went on until early  Since then Freyja says it’s been a learning curve to keep focus and work through her concentration and reconstruction of the language primarily nouns and memory loss Restorative Body Balm – Age Well Intensive Moisturising Balm – Daily Rejuvenating Face Oil The most important step for her post treatment is to share her health research in the easiest most simple and delicious way So she created her Wholesome World App Trading Address The Health and Wellbeing Innovation Centre Treliske Truro Cornwall TR1 3FF Made For Life Organics Limited VAT Number GB Company number  Registered Address Spiezia Organics Ltd Made for Life Organics Glendyn Hook Heath Road Woking Surrey GUQE

There is still a great deal of confusion and concern about how to move forward and throw those spa and hospitality doors wide Someone must lead and in terms of Courage Here are some thoughts which I would like to share and I hope you will find useful Courage could be used as an acronym for the following This is the start of planning and moving forward It involves good honest conversations with yourself and your teams about how you move forward and why How do you do this As a former hotelier/tourism operator when we opened up a new venture we always did a ‘soft launch’ I recommend that this is what spa operators and hoteliers do Iron out any teething problems before you open fully to the public and engage with your teams so that everyone is involved Many still will be fearful – that is where they have been sitting for weeks now It is our job as leaders to engage and reassure that there is a future Let us have balance and understanding about COVID19 and the stats regarding the illness

spread of our Made for Life Skincare products The spread of it from the environment to our treatments and letting it cleanly immerse back in to the environment Healthy and clean for both our actual bodies’ and the surroundings The nature in Canada is a site to show how fast our environment is ‘updating’ as each generation passes Perfect travel size 10ml MFL – perfect for flights camera bags pockets  even handbags… It was beautiful to see our photographer Lucia Griggi take our environmentally clean and organic products to such a nature dominated environment I had an expedition on an icebreaker vessel throughout the NE passage – from Alaska circumnavigating the arctic through Canada and through to Artic Russia finishing in Norway Simply for my photography being focused on nature travel and expeditions worldwide The climate is amazing and there is a warm environment despite the cold stark temperature enhanced by the beautiful colourful land growths found in the wooden and rocky

source.content: There is still a great deal of confusion and concern about how to move forward and throw those spa and hospitality doors wide Someone must lead and in terms of Courage Here are some thoughts which I would like to share and I hope you will find useful Courage could be used as an acronym for the following This is the start of planning and moving forward It involves good honest conversations with yourself and your teams about how you move forward and why How do you do this As a former hotelier/tourism operator when we opened up a new venture we always did a ‘soft launch’ I recommend that this is what spa operators and hoteliers do Iron out any teething problems before you open fully to the public and engage with your teams so that everyone is involved Many still will be fearful – that is where they have been sitting for weeks now It is our job as leaders to engage and reassure that there is a future Let us have balance and understanding about COVID19 and the stats regarding the illness

they have been sitting for weeks now It is our job as leaders to engage and reassure that there is a future Let us have balance and understanding about COVID19 and the stats regarding the illness and implications This is a great time to engage with our existing customers and find out what it is that they would like to experience when they come back to us Before we implement new ideas and expense let us be sure of what it is that our customer wants Write to them engage and use a questionnaire ideally incentivised to help provide you with valuable data to help provide clarity The same with our teams In addition let us be clear on what is good and safe practice for both our teams and guests Leaders adapt and are innovative We are dealing with a new world Air travel is restricted and will continue to be for some time My personal belief is that air travel will become more like it was when I was growing up – a rare family treat that was costly Until people gain confidence and airlines even

to be for some time My personal belief is that air travel will become more like it was when I was growing up – a rare family treat that was costly Until people gain confidence and airlines even begin to recover more people will be taking breaks within the UK These are likely to be shorter – 2-3 days as the effects on the economy from COVID19 ripple across for some time For both our teams and our guests Let us make sure that our customers and teams clearly understand that we are delighted to see them again There is an opportunity to open our doors to those who have been in the frontline – NHS workers and others and allow them access to wellness and hospitality Bottom line profit is not the sole purpose of any business It is important but reconnecting within the community and showing what we stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what

As a Mum who struggled to breastfeed my second child I experienced first-hand the mental battle to continue as well as the outside pressures to stop despite my persistence to persevere Fortunately with the support and guidance of the Treliske Infant Feeding team in Cornwall have a look and the wonderful breastfeeding peer volunteers – I was successful in my journey and whole-heartedly enjoyed the breastfeeding relationship that I shared with my daughter After witnessing the incredible generosity of the volunteers I decided to complete my training and work alongside them I love supporting new Mums and Mums-to-be helping to prepare them for breastfeeding Since my involvement it has quickly become clear that no clear education or understanding of breastfeeding is given to women on a national basis – even in biology lessons and yet this is key to the improvement of breastfeeding rates in the UK What we are campaigning for is to introduce breastfeeding on the National Curriculum alongside

source.content: types of information whenever you interact with us For example like many web sites we use “cookies” Please read the madeforlifeorganicscom cookie policy here –  Your personal data is used for our internal business purposes only Madeforlifeorganicscom does not sell rent or lease your personal information to independent third parties except as described below We use personally identifiable information to identify account holders open and maintain accounts process and send orders service and enforce transactions send related communications to customers and to provide customer services and support Credit card numbers are used only for processing payments and are not used for other purposes or stored We may also use personal data to provide you with optional product or service updates promotional notices and offers and other information about Made for Life and its products As stated above madeforlifeorganicscom does not share our customer data with third parties except as described in the

Our Privacy Policy has been developed to provide you with an understanding of how we will use any personal data which you provide to us Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person An identifiable natural person is one who can be identified directly or indirectly in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name an identification number location data  an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical physiological genetic mental economic cultural or social identity of that natural person Data subject is any identified or identifiable natural person whose personal data is processed by the person responsible for the processing Such identifiable information is governed by our Privacy Policy and your use of this web site constitutes your acceptance of our Privacy Policy and the practices it describes Please note that our Privacy Policy governs personal data provided to us via our web site or to the Made for Life

Known as the Queen of Hugs Amanda is our company founder and leading light in the world of organic skincare for home and spa She has a background in hotel and events management as well as being a Reiki Master massage therapist and mindfulness trainer Outside work I like to “walk with our dogs around the vineyards close to our home in Spain feed our peacocks we had babies this year and swim at my favourite local beach” My favourite products are Facial Cleanser “I love the way if decongests and moisturises my skin The scent also gives me the perfect start and end to my day I  couldn’t live without the  Skin Solve with Calendula This is the first product I used on my family to soothe and solve my young daughter’s eczema” Known as the King of spreadsheets Geoff has worked for Made for Life for over 9 years but previously worked for many years in aerospace manufacturing and now brings his attention to detail to our organisation and products Outside work I like to “work on our old farmhouse

spread of our Made for Life Skincare products The spread of it from the environment to our treatments and letting it cleanly immerse back in to the environment Healthy and clean for both our actual bodies’ and the surroundings The nature in Canada is a site to show how fast our environment is ‘updating’ as each generation passes Perfect travel size 10ml MFL – perfect for flights camera bags pockets  even handbags… It was beautiful to see our photographer Lucia Griggi take our environmentally clean and organic products to such a nature dominated environment I had an expedition on an icebreaker vessel throughout the NE passage – from Alaska circumnavigating the arctic through Canada and through to Artic Russia finishing in Norway Simply for my photography being focused on nature travel and expeditions worldwide The climate is amazing and there is a warm environment despite the cold stark temperature enhanced by the beautiful colourful land growths found in the wooden and rocky

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The organization is collaborating with third-party companies who deliver emails about their products to customers. Additionally, they may work with unaffiliated third-party companies to help maintain and operate their web site.

notices and offers and other information about Made for Life and its products As stated above madeforlifeorganicscom does not share our customer data with third parties except as described in the next paragraph If you receive information about our products from another company Made for Life Organics has no control over the use of their data You will need to contact the company that delivered the email to opt out of receiving ongoing emails We may use third party unaffiliated companies to help us maintain and operate our web site or for other reasons related to the operation of our business and those companies may receive your personal data for that purpose Should we be required to do so we may also disclose personally identifiable information about you in connection with a legal claim governmental request or investigation Our secure server uses Secure Sockets Layer SSL encryption – the industry standard — when collecting or transferring sensitive data such as your credit card

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Based on the provided text, there doesn't seem to be any specific mention of joint events, projects, or initiatives between hotels, spas, and tourism operators. However, the text suggests that collaboration may be necessary during the transition period due to concerns and fears among individuals. The author encourages leaders to engage and reassure their teams and customers, emphasizing the importance of maintaining connections within the community.

source.content: There is still a great deal of confusion and concern about how to move forward and throw those spa and hospitality doors wide Someone must lead and in terms of Courage Here are some thoughts which I would like to share and I hope you will find useful Courage could be used as an acronym for the following This is the start of planning and moving forward It involves good honest conversations with yourself and your teams about how you move forward and why How do you do this As a former hotelier/tourism operator when we opened up a new venture we always did a ‘soft launch’ I recommend that this is what spa operators and hoteliers do Iron out any teething problems before you open fully to the public and engage with your teams so that everyone is involved Many still will be fearful – that is where they have been sitting for weeks now It is our job as leaders to engage and reassure that there is a future Let us have balance and understanding about COVID19 and the stats regarding the illness

to be for some time My personal belief is that air travel will become more like it was when I was growing up – a rare family treat that was costly Until people gain confidence and airlines even begin to recover more people will be taking breaks within the UK These are likely to be shorter – 2-3 days as the effects on the economy from COVID19 ripple across for some time For both our teams and our guests Let us make sure that our customers and teams clearly understand that we are delighted to see them again There is an opportunity to open our doors to those who have been in the frontline – NHS workers and others and allow them access to wellness and hospitality Bottom line profit is not the sole purpose of any business It is important but reconnecting within the community and showing what we stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what

stand for as a brand is long lasting When we put ourselves in someone else’s shoes we create a better understanding of the right thing to do moving forward Great communication in advance about what guests can expect prior to arrival assuring them not only of our hygiene standards but also the fact that a warm even if socially distanced welcome is what awaits them And that their wellbeing and that of our team is at the forefront of everything that we do So to all my friends within the hospitality and spa industry who are an amazing community and who show huge resilience and strength remember these words from Nelson Mandela “I learned that courage was not the absence of fear but the triumph over it The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid but he who conquers that fear” Read More I have my ‘pants of power’ very firmly on Come and join me Trading Address The Health and Wellbeing Innovation Centre Treliske Truro Cornwall TR1 3FF Made For Life Organics Limited VAT Number GB Company

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Collaborating between healthcare providers, hotels, tourism operators, and other relevant stakeholders has several mutual objectives and desired outcomes. By working together, these entities aim to achieve the following goals:

1. Support local economies: One objective is to revitalize local economies by encouraging domestic and international travel. Reopening spas and hotels, along with offering special packages or promotions, can attract visitors and stimulate economic growth.
2. Enhance guest experiences: Another shared goal is to improve guest experiences by providing seamless transitions between healthcare services and leisure activities. This may involve coordinated transportation options, joint marketing campaigns, or collaboration on amenities and facilities.
3. Promote wellness and recovery: A key outcome expected from these collaborations is improved wellness and recovery for patients, guests, and staff alike. By combining resources and expertise, partners can develop targeted wellness programs, support mental and emotional well-being, and facilitate post-treatment recovery.
4. Foster community connections: Collaborations between healthcare providers, hotels, and tourism operators can also contribute to stronger community bonds. By working together, these entities can promote social distancing guidelines while maintaining a sense of normalcy and connection among residents and visitors.
5. Share best practices and knowledge: Mutual learning and knowledge sharing is another desirable outcome of these collaborations. Partners can exchange information on safety protocols, disease prevention strategies, and effective communication methods to ensure the safety and well-being of all parties involved.
6. Encourage responsible tourism: Finally, collaborations between healthcare providers, hotels, and tourism operators can work towards promoting responsible tourism practices. This includes minimizing environmental impact, supporting local businesses, and ensuring that tourism contributes positively to the overall well-being of host communities.
